notes: libretro core only - requires RetroArch; per-game NVRAM as .srm or shared 3DO.nvram file
Primary recommended emulator; requires pegasus.zip BIOS
Portable app - config stored in executable directory; saves within emulated disk images (.hdf); macOS port available via github.com/richstokes/arculator-mac
Multi-system emulator; NVRAM stores game settings/high scores; save states in sta directory
Multi-system emulator; winget package not yet available but ID reserved; also has MAME 2003/2010/2016 RetroArch cores for older ROM sets
Highly accurate emulator; available as snap (caprice32); also has libretro core (cap32)
RetroArch/libretro core; saves as 'content-name#.SNA' in content directory
.sna;.dsk
.sna
Multi-system emulator; winget package not yet available but ID reserved; emulates cpc464/cpc664/cpc6128/gx4000
Proprietary; also emulates ZX Spectrum/MSX/SMS; available as snap (mmartinortiz-retro-virtual-machine)
.dsk;.cdt
Cycle-accurate emulator; also emulates CPC464/664/6128/Plus and KC Compact
Available as Snap package on Linux; also has libretro core
Windows-only fork with DirectX/OpenGL rendering
Multi-system emulator; GX4000 driver name is gx4000
Multi-system emulator; also supports ZX Spectrum and MSX
RetroArch core only; originally a Nintendo DS emulator
Linux-only container-based emulator running LineageOS; runs Android 13; requires Wayland
Proprietary; free for personal use; requires VirtualBox on Windows; uses QEMU on Linux/macOS
Official Google emulator; limited to supported titles; Windows only; cloud saves via Google Drive
GPLv2; high performance; requires Intel VT; Hyper-V or HAXM; includes OpenGApps
Actively maintained; recommended emulator; absorbed MESS project
Accurate emulation with debugging capabilities; version 20100803; inactive
Easy to setup; no debugging; version 080418; inactive; author: Enrique Collado
Open multiplatform emulator for Soviet computers including Radio-86RK and Apogee. Web version at http://online.emu80.org
Emulates Apogee via Radio-86RK driver. MAME driver name is 'apogee'. Good emulation status.
Multi-system emulator; winget package not available; emulates apple2/apple2p/apple2e/apple2ee/apple2gs; nvram in ~/.mame/nvram
Most popular Windows Apple II emulator; supports II/II+/IIe/Enhanced IIe; legacy .aws format deprecated
Linux port of AppleWin; supports II/II+/IIe/Enhanced IIe; available in AUR as linapple-git; save states via F11/F12
Cycle-accurate emulator; available as snap (clock-signal); supports II/II+/IIe; no documented save state support
Kent's Emulated GS; BRAM stored within config.kegs file; requires ROM image from real hardware; v1.38 current; no package manager distributions available
High-level emulator for iPhone OS 2.x/3.x apps; Linux requires self-build; Apple Silicon macOS works via Rosetta; no firmware required
68k Mac emulator for System 6.0.7 to Mac OS 8.1. Disk images stored in configured paths.
PowerPC Mac emulator for Mac OS 7.5.2 to 9.0.4. No JIT on ARM hosts.
Early Mac emulator (128K to Classic). RetroArch core available. Saves to 'out' folder on Linux.
Cycle-accurate Mac 512ke/Plus emulator. Snap package on Linux. Document-based app on macOS.
Multi-system emulator supporting all 68k Macs. Various RetroArch core versions available.
KVM-based virtualization for running macOS on Linux. Supports Monterey, Ventura, Sonoma.
Apple Silicon native virtualizer for macOS 12+. Requires macOS 13 or later on host.
Hyper-V based virtualization for macOS on Windows. Requires OpenCore.
Most comprehensive arcade emulator; multiple RetroArch cores available (mame_2003
macOS/Linux standalone ports not actively maintained; libretro core recommended for cross-platform
Laserdisc arcade emulator; fork of Daphne with Singe support; Singe games save to game directory
Modern PC-based arcade hardware emulator; closed-source; runs via Wine on Linux with limited success
Sega Model 3 arcade emulator; no GUI - command line only
Naomi/Naomi 2/Atomiswave arcade boards; also emulates Dreamcast; iOS support dropped
Recommended. Arduboy FX simulator with profiling/debugging. Also has web player at tiberiusbrown.github.io/Ardens/. RetroArch core supports saves/states. Accepts .hex and .arduboy files.
The go-to emulator for Atari 2600; cycle-accurate with extensive debugging capabilities; Time Machine feature for rewinding gameplay
RetroArch/libretro core; states saved as 'content-name'.state#; no traditional saves (Atari 2600 had no battery save)
Java-based (requires JRE 8+); cycle-accurate; also emulates C64/C128/VIC-20/ZX Spectrum; saves snapshots in working directory
Also emulates Atari 8-bit computers (400/800/XL/XE)
Proprietary; high accuracy; only emulator officially supporting Rikki & Vikki
Multi-system emulator with high accuracy
Fork of MAME Atari 7800 driver with enhancements; GPLv2
Development ceased in 2008; RetroArch core still maintained; no SRAM saves only save states
Windows-only; highly accurate cycle-exact emulation; excellent debugger; internal kernel available
Cross-platform; config at ~/.atari800.cfg; also emulates Atari 5200
Cycle-precise; built-in ROM fallback; config at ~/.atari++.conf
First emulator with 100% retail compatibility; supports Jaguar CD; proprietary license; also available on App Store
Open source GPLv3; libretro core still actively maintained; standalone development inactive
RECOMMENDED; first and only emulator with full Jaguar CD compatibility; closed source; supports Memory Track and VLM
Uses Virtual Jaguar core internally; only a few Jaguar CD games work; primarily for TAS/speedrunning
Flatpak is via Mednaffe frontend which bundles Mednafen
Multi-system emulator; Lynx support via MAME softlist
Cycle-exact emulator; EEPROM save support; Windows only but works in Wine
Requires TOS ROM image or EmuTOS; supports ST/STE/TT/Falcon
Highly accurate ST emulation; libretro core is Windows-only beta
68040 VM rather than strict emulator; supports TT/Falcon; requires TOS 4.04 or EmuTOS
Windows-only; highly accurate cycle-exact emulation; excellent debugger; internal kernel available
Cross-platform; config at ~/.atari800.cfg; also emulates Atari 5200
Cycle-precise; built-in ROM fallback; config at ~/.atari++.conf
Multi-purpose emulation framework; only recommended emulator for this system
Recommended; uses NVRAM for game saves and cfg for settings
Supports B/B+/Master 128 models; config in ~/Documents/BeebEm/Preferences.cfg; quicksave via keypad //*
Comprehensive model support including Master Turbo/512; Linux config at ~/.config/b-em/b-em.cfg
Supports BBC B/B+/Master 128/Master Compact; available as snap on Linux; libretro core has no save support
High accuracy WonderSwan emulation; uses game folder system with save.ram files; 100% compatibility with Pocket Challenge V2 games
High accuracy; built-in debugger and profiler; supports WonderSwan/Color in Mesen 2.x
Mid-level accuracy; RetroArch core name is beetle_cygne; Flatpak is via Mednaffe GUI frontend which includes Mednafen
Open-source emulator for Lynx 48K/96K. Linux support via Raspberry Pi ARM build. Settings stored in non-roaming app data folder on Windows.
Camputers Lynx support since v0.167. Improved tape support in v0.200. Save states in sta/ dir. NVRAM in nvram/ dir.
Dedicated Casio Loopy emulator; runs all games; requires BIOS files; command-line only
Casio Loopy support added in MAME 0.260; requires casloopy.zip BIOS; use shortname 'casloopy'
Only 15 games released for PV-1000; use shortname 'pv1000'; no BIOS required
Recommended; active development; Qt6-based; includes debugger and T-DOS support
Recommended; better ColecoVision compatibility than MAME; standalone uses savestates folder
Requires BIOS files: adam.zip adam_ddp.zip adam_fdc.zip adam_kb.zip adam_prn.zip
Complete ADAM emulation since v5.0; supports keyboard disk and tape drives
SDL2 port; includes Super Game Module support and composite video filter
Recommended for ColecoVision; better compatibility than MAME/MESS. Requires coleco BIOS romset.
BSD-3-Clause license; also emulates CreatiVision and My Vision.
Long-standing emulator with mobile versions. Supports Super Game Module and EEPROM saves.
Tool-assisted speedrun emulator with full rerecording and Lua scripting support. Supports RetroAchievements.
Multi-system emulator focused on accuracy and preservation. Descendant of higan/bsnes.
Accurate Z80 and TMS9918 emulation. Supports Super Game Module (SGM) and MegaCart ROMs.
Versatile Commodore Emulator supporting C64/C128/VIC20/PET/PLUS4/CBM-II
Cycle-accurate emulation with x64sc; also available as vice_x64 core for faster but less accurate emulation
Windows-only cycle-exact emulator; settings stored in Windows registry or hoxs64.ini
Cycle-accurate macOS-native emulator; uses workspace bundles for save states
Java-based cross-platform emulator; requires JRE 8+
Scala-based emulator; also emulates C128 VIC20 CBM2 and SuperCPU
Based on VICE; supports save states; available on Google Play
Based on VICE; available on F-Droid; includes built-in games and time-machine feature
Cross-platform with focus on gaming; based on WinUAE; built-in WHDLoad support

Optimized for ARM and Linux; based on WinUAE; supports WHDLoad
Native macOS app for Amiga 500/1000/2000; document-based save system
RetroArch/libretro core; continuation of E-UAE; supports CD32 and CDTV

Most accurate Amiga emulator; Windows only; supports CDTV mode
Cross-platform; based on WinUAE code; supports CDTV emulation
RetroArch/libretro core; continuation of E-UAE; CDTV NVRAM saves as .nvr

Use driver "max" for dedicated MAX Machine emulation; comprehensive documentation

Versatile Commodore Emulator; emulates Plus/4 via xplus4 binary; supports C16/C116/Plus4/V364 variants
Open source GPLv2; High accuracy; Part of VICE emulator collection

Most accurate Dragon 32/64 emulator; also emulates Tandy CoCo 1/2
Supports Dragon 32/64 and Project Alpha/Beta; part of multi-system emulator

Libretro port; no native saves; supports save states and rewind; requires BIOS ROMs in system/bk folder
Recommended. High accuracy emulator by James Jacobs. Also emulates Interton VC 4000 family and other Signetics 2650-based systems. Portable application stores saves alongside executable.
Recommended Android port of WinArcadia subset. Requires Android 8.0+. COS save states not cross-compatible with WinArcadia.
Multi-system emulator. Arcadia 2001 support via MESS integration. Requires ar_bios.zip and arcadia.xml hash file.
Most accurate Enterprise 64/128 emulator; also emulates ZX Spectrum and Amstrad CPC
Multi-purpose emulation framework; primary recommended emulator for Adventure Vision; requires advision.zip BIOS

Requires gamepock.zip BIOS file containing egpcboot.bin
Standalone Windows emulator; basis for EmuSCV libretro core
RetroArch/libretro core based on eSCV; saves not supported by core itself
Multi-system emulator; .nv for NVRAM; .sta for save states
Listed as Good support on Emulation General Wiki; requires sorcerer.zip and sorcererd.zip BIOS files
Java-based browser emulator; uses TAPE format for cassette images
Freeware; last updated 2002; runs WSorcer.exe; no BIOS required
Multi-system emulator with accurate Fairchild Channel F emulation; multiple RetroArch cores available (mame_2003

Recommended; No longer maintained; Latest version (3.4L77SX+z09) Windows only; earlier versions for other platforms
Active development; FM-7 driver experimental; Supports fm7 and fm77av models
Primary recommendation; 97%+ compatibility; actively developed; CMOS file stores BIOS settings; specify location with -CMOS parameter
High compatibility; last updated 2010; saves to floppy disk images; Japanese documentation but English interface
FM Towns driver improving; use fmtowns fmtownsux or fmtmarty drivers; experimental status
Sound emulation is preliminary; MAME is the only known emulator for this system

No recommended emulators found. The Game Wave is not listed on the Emulation General Wiki. Only a fan research project exists (github.com/gamewavefans/GameWaveFans) which has developed file unpacking tools but no playable emulator. The console uses DVD-based media with Lua scripting and has a small 13-game library of trivia/puzzle games.
Proprietary; inactive since 2004; requires BIOS; saves stored in virtual SMC files; not marked as recommended
GP32 driver status is Preliminary; requires gp32.zip BIOS files; not marked as recommended; libretro core available via mame core
No recommended emulators found. The GameWave (ZAPiT Games, 2005) remains unemulated. GameWaveFans project on GitHub provides file extraction tools but no working emulator.

Multi-system emulator; Game Master support added in version 0.139; also known as Systema 2000 and Super Game

No recommended emulators found. MAME has a skeleton driver (non-functional) for Picno. The system is categorized as "not yet emulated" on the Emulation General Wiki.

No recommended emulators found. The Emulation General Wiki indicates that there are currently no emulators available for any LeapPad devices (original 1999 model, LeapPad Explorer, LeapPad2, LeapPad3). MAME has preliminary Leapster support but not LeapPad. Preservation efforts are ongoing.
No recommended emulators found. MAME has a preliminary driver but is marked NOT recommended - the driver is a skeleton that does not work (GAME_NOT_WORKING | GAME_NO_SOUND | GAME_IS_SKELETON).
Wine Is Not an Emulator. Compatibility layer for running Windows applications. Default WINEPREFIX is ~/.wine. Includes Winetricks for dependency management.

Open source GPLv3 emulator/simulator. Also available on Steam. Paid ($3 USD). Active development.
Pseudo-emulation by University of Pittsburgh Vibrant Media Lab. Free. In development.
HTML/JavaScript browser-based simulator. Runs in any modern web browser. Free.
Built on LÃ–VE framework. Games as separate executables. Free. Inactive.
MS-DOS emulator; requires DOSBox on modern systems. Created 1999. Free. Inactive.
Nintendo DS homebrew only. Created by Bobbyloujo (2010). Free. Inactive.

Primary Odyssey 2/Videopac+ emulator; not actively maintained but highly compatible

Dedicated Memotech MTX emulator. Recommended. Command-line based. Also supports Raspberry Pi and Linux framebuffer. Original by Andy Key.
Multi-system emulator with MTX512 support (driver: memotech/mtx.cpp). Use romset mtx512.
Most accurate MSX emulator; includes C-BIOS for cartridge games without original firmware; supports MSX TurboR and Palcom LaserDisc games
Cycle-accurate emulator; inactive but still functional; standalone only runs on Windows; libretro core available cross-platform via RetroArch
One of the earliest MSX emulators; highly portable; libretro core available; non-commercial license

Multi-system emulator with MSX2+ support via software lists

Supports MSX/MSX2/MSX2+; based on fMSX 6.0 by Marat Fayzullin
Based on blueMSX; paid app on Google Play ($7.99); supports SCC and FM sound
Multi-system emulator; also emulates MSX1/MSX2/MSX2+/TurboR; GPLv2/BSD-3-Clause license

Windows only; runs via Wine on Linux; 16% game compatibility; HLE-based emulator
Primary recommended Xbox 360 emulator; ~55% game compatibility; Linux support via Xenia Canary/Edge builds; saves organized in content/[ProfileXUID]/[GameID]/[ContentType] structure
Primary Xbox 360 emulator; macOS experimental via CrossOver/Wine; Canary build available (Xenia.XeniaCanary); saves stored in content subfolder by title ID; no traditional file extensions for saves

Recommended Xbox 360 emulator; Linux support experimental via native builds or Proton; saves use Xbox 360 STFS format (CON containers) without traditional file extensions; macOS support very experimental via unofficial xenia-mac port
Title Updates are handled by Xbox 360 emulators; Xenia Canary branch recommended; Linux support experimental via Wine/Proton

No recommended emulators found. Xbox One emulation is still in early experimental stages. WinDurango (https://github.com/WinDurango/WinDurango) is the only publicly available project but is not recommended - only Minecraft: Xbox One Edition runs successfully.
No recommended emulators found - no working emulators exist for Xbox Series X/S as of 2025. Most games are available as PC ports.

Fork of J2ME Loader with more frequent updates; improved soundfont support; better external storage access
High compatibility with advanced homebrew development features; Windows XP-11; Linux GTK3; macOS 10.13+

Web-based emulator with iOS App Store native app; supports OS 1-4 (Dragonball) and OS5 (Tungsten E2); browser localStorage for saves

Early development; only Crash Nitro Kart 3D and Double Dragon and Zeebo Family Pack fully playable; WIP recommended on Emulation General Wiki
Complete DOS emulation package with Windows 3.x/9x support; extensive configuration options

Recommended; version 0.86 rev99; best accuracy for later PC-98 models (1993-2000); supports PC-9821 features; add STATSAVE=true to np21w.ini to enable save states
Recommended; libretro/RetroArch core; cross-platform; based on Neko Project II; config at system/np2kai/np2kai.cfg; requires BIOS files in np2kai directory
Recommended; actively maintained; PC-98 mode via machine=pc98 config; easy setup; also available as libretro core dosbox_pure; Flatpak config at ~/.var/app/com.dosbox_x.DOSBox-X/config/dosbox-x/
Mid-High accuracy; primary recommended emulator; Flatpak provides Mednaffe GUI frontend which includes Mednafen

HLE 3DS emulator; experimental libretro core available; New 3DS support partial
Active Citra fork; merger of PabloMK7 Citra and Lime3DS; recommended over discontinued Citra
HLE emulator; experimental libretro core available

Recommended; multi-system emulator focusing on accuracy and preservation

97% compatibility; also emulates GameCube; near-daily updates; recommended to sync Wii remote for motion controls
Primary emulator for Wii/GameCube; 97% game compatibility; supports Wiimote via Bluetooth; iOS available via DolphinIOS
Open source since 2022; Android version is experimental beta; macOS uses MoltenVK for Vulkan
Open-source Wii U emulator; saves stored in mlc01/usr/save/[title_id] structure
Symbian OS and N-Gage emulator. Saves stored in emulated drive structure under data/drives/. Development significantly reduced as of March 2023.

No recommended emulators found. Nuance Resurrection (Windows;Linux) at https://github.com/andkrau/NuanceResurrection is the only serious NUON emulator capable of running commercial games but is not marked as recommended. MAME also has NUON support but is explicitly not recommended for this system.

OpenBOR is a game engine not an emulator. Games run natively using the OpenBOR engine. Each game is a .pak file. macOS support is discontinued. No package manager distributions available - download from ChronoCrash or GitHub.
Recommended for Oric on macOS/Linux. Save states not yet fully implemented. Available via Snap on Linux (clock-signal).
Portable emulator for Oric-1/Atmos/Telestrat/Pravetz 8D. GPL-2.0 licensed. Includes bundled ROMs.
Multi-system emulator supporting Oric Atmos via orica driver. Use with libretro:mame core in RetroArch.
Very accurate SG-1000/SMS/GG emulator with debugger. Also available via RetroArch.
100% SG-1000 compatibility. Only available as RetroArch core on desktop platforms.

save_extensions: 95-100% Othello Multivision compatibility. Supports special OMV keyboard. Includes debugging tools.
.Lightweight emulator supporting SG-1000 variants including Othello Multivision.

notes: No recommended emulators found; OUYA runs Android 4.1 (Jelly Bean) so general Android emulators (BlueStacks, NoxPlayer) can be used with the OUYA Framework APK installed; wiki does not mark any specific emulator as recommended
Multi-system emulator with highly accurate PC Engine/SuperGrafx emulation. Flatpak available via Mednaffe frontend which includes Mednafen.
Easiest and most stable method for CD-i emulation; lacks Digital Video Cartridge (DVC) support
Libretro core forked from MAME; simplified CD loading; game-specific NVRAM directories
Recommended; High accuracy; Also emulates OdysseyÂ²
Recommended but inactive; Has libretro core o2em; Requires o2rom.bin or g7400.bin BIOS
Official implementation (proprietary); purchase required; recommended
Open-source reimplementation; GPLv3; lower compatibility than official
MIT license; homebrew platforms only; no desktop builds; best open-source compatibility

Freeware pinball table editor and simulator. Uses VPinMAME for ROM emulation. Config at ~/.vpinball/VPinballX.ini (Linux/macOS) or %APPDATA%/VPinballX/ (Windows). Tables use .vpx format. NVRAM stores high scores and settings. Available as Snap package (visual-pinball) on Linux.
Recommended; specialized RCA CDP1802 multi-system emulator supporting Studio II/III/IV. Cartridge format is .st2. Has built-in games including Doodle Patterns Bowling Freeway Additions.
Driver studio2; sound emulation imperfect. Requires studio2 BIOS. All official ROMs have been dumped.
Primary recommended emulator. LibRetro core is experimental with limited features. Output files saved to ~/SimCoupe on Linux.
Multi-platform Dreamcast/NAOMI/Atomiswave emulator. Standalone save files are vmu_save_A1.bin etc in data directory. RetroArch core saves to system/dc/vmu_save_*.bin
Windows-only closed-source emulator. VMU saves as vms00.bin in emulator directory. NVRAM files in nvram subfolder. Requires Atomiswave BIOS.
Game engine recreation for classic adventure games; supports 280+ games; not a traditional emulator but runs game data files directly
95% 32X compatibility as of v131; most accurate 32X emulation available
Only RetroArch core with 32X and Pico support; prioritizes speed over accuracy
Uses bundled PicoDrive core; designed for TAS and rerecording
Driver status is imperfect (graphics/timing/sound); MAME 0.284+ required; Run with 'mame beena <rom>'
100% Sega CD compatibility; available only through RetroArch on most platforms
86% of Mega CD library playable to completion as of v132; standalone multi-system emulator
Supports Sega CD and 32X; primarily available through RetroArch; originally designed for ARM handhelds
Sega CD support is experimental in nightly builds only; very high Genesis/Mega Drive accuracy
Best option for Sega CD 32X accuracy; v132 brought 86% Mega CD compatibility and 95% 32X compatibility
Only RetroArch core with 32X support; designed for weak devices; standalone releases outdated - libretro port recommended
Fork of reicast with 99% compatibility; supports NAOMI/Atomiswave; GPLv2 licensed
Closed-source; no BIOS required; premium version available for HD rendering
Modifies .vmu and .bin files in-place; supports Flycast connectivity and VMU-to-VMU serial connections
RetroArch/libretro core only; sound slightly buggy; restart content causes crash
Very high accuracy; libretro core only - no standalone version; also supports Master System and Mega Drive
High accuracy; multi-system emulator descended from higan/bsnes; focuses on preservation
Very high accuracy; requires Java; excellent debugging tools; also supports Game Boy and Master System
Universal arcade/console emulator; high compatibility but complex setup for console games
Active development; MIT licensed; also supports Master System and SG-1000; Linux only
Highly accurate; available only through RetroArch/libretro on desktop platforms; native versions for Wii/GameCube
Multi-system emulator; no libretro core available; cycle-accurate emulation
Supports 32X; designed for ARM devices; available through RetroArch
Fast and highly accurate; standalone available on all platforms
Best Hikaru compatibility; closed-source; requires BIOS files
Preliminary Hikaru support; games marked as not working; open-source
Very high accuracy; available primarily as RetroArch/libretro core; also available via OpenEmu on macOS

save_extensions: Active development; MIT license; also supports SG-1000 and Game Gear

notes: Very high accuracy; comprehensive hardware support; multi-system emulator
High accuracy; descendant of higan/bsnes; multi-system emulator
Java-based; includes debugger and development tools; also supports Game Boy and Game Gear
Only emulator capable of running Sega Model 1 games; NVRAM stores high scores and settings
Closed-source; abandoned since 2014; best compatibility for Model 2 games; requires DirectX 9.0; Windows-only
Active development; cross-platform; fewer Model 2 games fully working; requires fast CPU
Open-source Model 3 emulator with good compatibility; libretro core in development but not yet available
Fork of reicast; supports Dreamcast/NAOMI/NAOMI 2/Atomiswave; GPLv2 licensed; HLE BIOS available
Closed-source; supports NAOMI/NAOMI 2/Hikaru/Atomiswave/System SP; requires BIOS; last updated April 2018
Added NAOMI 2 support in August 2022; fork of reicast; GPLv2 licensed; requires NAOMI 2 BIOS
Closed-source; first emulator with NAOMI 2 support; requires BIOS; revived December 2025; supports Hikaru/Atomiswave/System SP
One of the few emulators supporting Sega Pico; standalone builds outdated - use RetroArch core instead; fork by irixxxx is actively maintained
High accuracy Saturn emulation; Beetle Saturn is the libretro port
91.88% compatibility; supports ARM; integrated backup memory manager
Good out-of-box experience; libretro core is outdated/unmaintained
Recommended for PC/x86 platforms; proprietary license; netplay support
Recommended for comprehensive hardware/peripheral support; GPLv2/BSD-3-Clause license
Proprietary; also emulates SC-3000 and SF-7000; supports RetroAchievements and netplay
Multi-system emulator; also available via homebrew cask 'mame'; GPLv2/BSD-3-Clause license
Libretro core only on PC; standalone for Wii/GameCube; very accurate emulation
Available via snap; accurate Z80 emulation; includes debugger
Most compatible ST-V emulator; requires stvbios.zip
Experimental ST-V support since v1.31.0; highly accurate
Fork of Yaba Sanshiro; requires OpenGL 4.3; standalone saves in bkram.bin
Primary arcade emulator with highest compatibility; focuses on accuracy over performance

save_extensions: Better performance than MAME on lower-end hardware; explicitly supports System 16/18/24

notes: All System 32 ROMs decrypted; primary recommended emulator for arcade boards
Unmaintained branch of Dolphin (last updated 2014). Requires gecko codes for many games. GitHub mirrors available at github.com/EIGHTFINITE/dolphin-triforce
Closed-source arcade emulator. Premium subscription required for some games. Supports Mario Kart Arcade GP series
Imperfect emulation status; driver is sharp/mz2500.cpp; savestate support listed as unsupported in MAME
Part of Common Source Code Project by Takeda Toshiya; also known as SuperMZ and HINOTORI
Part of Common Source Code Project; best emulator for X1 Twin support; receives frequent updates
X1 and X1 Turbo support; X1 Turbo Z and X1 Twin cores non-functional as of Nov 2019
Recommended; excellent X68000 emulation with fully configurable peripheral cards; supports MIDI output to hardware devices like MT-32 or SC-55; requires BIOS files (cgrom.dat and iplrom.dat)

Recommended; considerably faster than MAME on both PC and mobile; libretro core only; configurable CPU clock speeds and RAM options; requires BIOS files in system/keropi/ directory (cgrom.dat and iplrom.dat); saves written directly to disk images

save_extensions: Cycle-accurate emulator; MIT licensed; Snap available on Linux (clock-signal)

notes: Multi-system emulator; GPLv3 licensed; supports ZX80/81/Spectrum and more
Portable Windows app; also works via Wine on Linux/macOS; GPLv2 licensed
Free Unix Spectrum Emulator; supports 16K/48K/128K/+2/+2A/+3 and clones; GPLv2
Portable emulator with embedded ZXDB database; internal savestates; public domain
Supports ZX80/81/Spectrum/128K/+2/+3/Pentagon/ZX-Uno/ZX-Next; GPLv3
.z80;.sna;.scr
Windows-only; primarily ZX80/ZX81 emulator but also supports ZX Spectrum; GPLv2
Free Unix Spectrum Emulator; GPLv2 license; supports all Spectrum models including +3
Proprietary license; Android version available on Play Store; supports 16kB/48kB/128kB and +2/+2A/+3 models
GPLv3 license; multi-system emulator supporting 40+ vintage machines; Intel-only on macOS (requires Rosetta 2)
Comprehensive multi-system emulator; AES mode via Universe BIOS
Active development; full AES compatibility; libretro core recommended for Linux/macOS
Highly accurate AES/MVS emulator; uses .NEO ROM format only
Multi-system emulator; Neo Geo AES support; active development
Full Neo Geo CD support; requires CHD format for CD images; requires neocdz.zip BIOS
Excellent Neo Geo CD support; requires neocdz.zip and neogeo.zip BIOS; available via RetroArch on mobile
Dedicated Neo Geo CD emulator; libretro core only; requires BIOS in neocd subfolder; supports CUE/BIN and CHD formats
Multi-purpose emulation framework; highly accurate; also emulates AES and Neo Geo CD

save_extensions: Arcade-focused emulator; supports CPS-1/2/3 and Neo Geo; active development; also emulates AES and Neo Geo CD
Highly accurate Neo Geo emulator; uses .NEO file format only; also emulates AES; no Neo Geo CD support

notes: Most accurate Neo Geo Pocket emulation
Beetle NeoPop is the libretro core name
General arcade/console emulator with NGP support
Most accurate Neo Geo Pocket emulator; configurable save path via Settings > Paths
Flatpak is for Mednaffe GUI frontend which bundles Mednafen
General-purpose arcade/system emulator; not optimized for NGP accuracy
Primary recommendation with 99.17% compatibility. RetroArch core is SwanStation (fork). Flatpak no longer maintained.
High accuracy emulator. Flatpak is Mednaffe GUI with Mednafen bundled. RetroArch cores are Beetle PSX and Beetle PSX HW.
High accuracy Japanese emulator. Memory cards stored as BU00/BU10 files without extension. Supports PocketStation.
Tool-assisted speedrun focused. Uses Mednafen's Nymashock/Octoshock core internally. Accepted by speedrun community.
Optimized for ARM devices. Best for low-powered hardware. Uses HLE BIOS if no BIOS found.
Primary recommended emulator with 99.67% compatibility. Memory cards use .ps2 extension; save states use .p2s extension.
Quality-of-life patch for AetherSX2. Recommended for Android. Removes ads and adds features.

save_extensions: Open-source PS3 emulator with ~70% game compatibility. Save data uses PS3 folder structure with PARAM.SFO metadata files. Save states stored in savestates folder.

notes: Open-source PS3 emulator; savestates stored in ~/.config/rpcs3/savestates/
.sav;param.sfo
No recommended emulators found. PS5 emulation is in very early stages. RPCSX (Linux) and Kyty (Windows) exist but cannot run commercial games.
HLE PSP emulator with excellent compatibility; supports HD upscaling and texture filtering
PSX2PSP creates PS1 EBOOT.PBP files; DuckStation plays unencrypted PBP format; official PSN eboots not supported
RetroArch core with PBP support; .srm and .mcr formats are internally identical and interchangeable
No UMD Music support - PPSSPP is the recommended PSP emulator but explicitly lacks UMD Video/Music playback

Partial UMD Video support (not UMD-PG games). Java-based emulator requiring JRE 8. Not marked as recommended on wiki but only emulator with UMD Video support. PPSSPP (recommended for PSP games) explicitly lacks UMD Video support.
Only recommended Vita emulator; saves stored by Title ID; no save states supported
PS Vita uses directory-based saves per game Title ID; approximately 57.5% game compatibility
Requires KROM (kernel ROM) file; uses STAT file for saves; Android app ID: com.dokutajigokusai.pk201
High accuracy; requires PocketStation BIOS; some games have compatibility issues
HLE emulator with 84% compatibility; saves use per-game folders in SAVEDATA with game ID prefix
PSP Minis run on standard PSP emulators; standalone version recommended over libretro core
Primary recommended emulator; driver name is m5 (Japan) or m5p (Europe); RetroArch saves to saves/mame/STATES
Takeda Toshiya's emulator; part of multi-system archive; requires BIOS ROM
Recommended MSX emulator with full Spectravideo SVI-318/SVI-328 support; requires SVI BIOS ROMs for full emulation
Inactive but cycle-accurate; supports SVI-318/SVI-328/SVI-328 MK2; standalone version Windows only; also available as RetroArch core
Cycle-accurate SNES emulator; 100% compatibility; HD Mode 7 support in bsnes-hd variant; multiple RetroArch cores (bsnes/bsnes-hd)
High-accuracy emulator; 99.5% compatibility; excellent performance; multiple RetroArch core versions (snes9x/snes9x_2010)
Cycle-accurate multi-system emulator; 99.94% SNES compatibility; save path configurable in Settings > Paths; no RetroArch core
Cycle-accurate multi-system emulator; RetroArch core is Mesen-S; Flatpak is unofficial community build
Out-of-the-box solution for Type X/X+/X2/X3/X4 games; closed-source; can run on Linux via Wine/Lutris with limited success
Bundled with JVSEmu; Save Patch feature moves saves to SV folder in game directory; no official download site

No recommended emulators found. The Emulation General Wiki lists Tapwave Zodiac under 'Strange and forgotten consoles' with emulator status 'None'. The Zodiac uses ARM9 hardware with Palm OS 5.x which is difficult to emulate. Projects like rePalm have reverse-engineering work but no fully functional emulator exists.
Includes TI ROMs under license; easiest to set up; works on Linux/Mac via Wine
Most accurate emulation; supports TI-99/4 TI-99/4A TI-99/8 and Geneve; requires ti99_4a BIOS
All Game.com games work in MAME; also available as mame_libretro core in RetroArch
Default recommended emulator; requires tutor.zip BIOS; supports cartridges and all graphics modes
Emulates CoCo 1/2/3 and MC-10; most accurate standalone emulator
CoCo 3 emulator; Windows only; supports MPI and FD-502
Cross-platform port of VCC; CoCo 3 emulator
Supports coco/coco2/coco2b/coco3/coco3p; requires BIOS files
Official recommended Uzebox emulator with cycle-perfect AVR emulation; EEPROM saves stored alongside game file; experimental Android port available
Original Uzebox emulator; part of main Uzebox repository; has remote debugging and mouse support not in CUzeBox; available as RetroArch/libretro core
Uzebox support via MESS sub-project; accepts .bin and .uze files; sound emulation has occasional issues
Modern actively-developed emulator with debugging features; FDD support; up to 8 RAM-disk support; AY sound; playback recording
Open-source C++ emulator; command-line interface; ChaiScript scripting; GDB integration; BASIC program support
Multi-system emulator with Vector-06C support via software lists; requires vector06c ROM set
Multi-purpose emulation framework; CreatiVision driver since v0.135
100% compatibility with CreatiVision library; BSD-3-Clause license; no standalone packages available
Recommended; partially emulated; also has versioned RetroArch cores (mame2003 etc.)
V.Smile emulation is limited due to incompatible MAME romsets for certain games
Official runtime; install via npm (npm install -g wasm4) or download from GitHub releases; also bundleable as standalone native executable
Multi-system frontend; WASM-4 core available through Online Updater; supports save states and netplay
Primary recommended emulator; available as libretro core via RetroArch; standalone SDL2 version also exists; supports RetroAchievements and Magnum hardware variant
Closed-source Windows-only emulator; spot-on emulation accuracy; supports save states and custom palettes; may struggle on less powerful systems
Actively maintained fork of PCem with optimized performance; requires BIOS ROMs
Original x86 PC emulator; 86Box is the recommended fork
Comprehensive DOS/Windows 9x emulation; significantly different from other DOSBox forks
Optimized for RetroArch/Libretro with shader support; loads games directly from ZIP files
Bespoke emulator for curated LucasArts games; no separate OS installation required
Full x86 PC emulator; requires BIOS ROMs; excellent Windows 3.x compatibility
Complete DOS/Windows 3.x/9x emulation package; built-in DOS implementation
Modern DOSBox continuation; requires Windows 3.x install for Windows software
RetroArch/libretro core only; supports save states and ZIP loading
Low-level x86 emulator; requires BIOS ROMs; original project that 86Box forked from
High accuracy multi-system emulator; WonderSwan support in Mesen 2; GPLv3 license; standalone Mesen does not have a libretro core for WonderSwan but Beetle WonderSwan (mednafen_wswan) is available
High accuracy multi-system emulator; descendant of higan/bsnes; ISC license; no libretro core available
High accuracy; on par with ares; built-in debugger and profiler

save_directory: Same directory as ROM or user-configured path
notes: High accuracy; descendant of higan/bsnes; supports 40+ systems
Mid accuracy; command-line driven; Beetle Cygne is the libretro core name
Laserdisc/VHS emulator; saves high scores to ram directory or save.cfg in game folder
Preliminary XaviXPORT support since v0.206. Graphics and sound marked as imperfect. Some later XaviXPORT games using XaviX 2 CPU are not emulated.
Recommended for ZN-1/ZN-2/Namco System 11 arcade hardware. MAME developers state it does everything the original ZiNc emulator did but better.
